text:
League 1
ASSE: big blow for William Saliba
The young defender of ASSE William Saliba will be unavailable for the Europa League match against Oleksandria. He is injured in the fifth metatarsal.
06 Nov 2019, 16:21 by Antoine Chirat



Harold MoukoudiClub previous: Le HavreTransfer fee: noneIcon Sport



Jean-Eudes Aholou Previous club: AS MonacoTransfer fee: none (ready) Icon Sport



Alpha SissokoClub previous: ClermontTransfer allowance: noneIcon Sport



Yohan CabayeClub previous: without clubTransfer fee: noneIcon Sport



Sergi PalenciaClub previous: FC BarcelonaTransfer allowance: 2 M ‚Ç¨ Icon Sport



Miguel TraucoClub previous: FlamengoTransfer allowance: 1 M ‚Ç¨ Icon Sport



Denis BouangaClub previous: N√Æmes OlympiqueTransfer fee: ‚Ç¨ 4.5 M Icon Sport



Ryad BoudebouzClub previous: Betis SevillaTransfer allowance: 3.5 M ‚Ç¨ Icon Sport



Zaydou Youssouf Previous club: Girondins de BordeauxTransfer allowance: 2 M ‚Ç¨ Icon Sport

ASSE: all the recruits of the transfer window 2019




This is the kind of news that fans of ASSE would have done well. Highly successful since his return from injury, the young William Saliba will have to make a new tour to the infiermerie. Indeed, his coach announced today that he would be absent for the Europa League match against Oleksandria because of a fracture in the fifth foot metatarsal, according to. A real blow for the Greens who had, since his return, found a real defensive base. Yann M'Vila will also be absent, just like Charles Abi.
